text: Sir Frederick Miles Warren (10 May 1929 â€“ 9 August 2022) was a New Zealand architect. He created the architecture firm Warren and Mahoney. He was known for designing buildings in Christchurch such as Christchurch Town Hall, Dorset St Flats, Harewood Crematorium and the College House. Warren died on 9 August 2022 in Christchurch at the age of 93. ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2022 deaths Category:People from Christchurch Category:New Zealand architects
title: Miles Warren
